sub_title: Staff Community Program Manager at Aiven, Microsoft MVP for Developer Technologies
summary:
Professionally, I worked on global-scale projects and events such as KubeCon + CloudNativeCon and HashiConf, and manage(d) several projects around inclusive communication strategies and (web and digital) accessibility.  
  
I’m a serial tech event organizer and as such responsible for EuRuKo 2019 (euruko2019.org), Devopsdays Amsterdam, ServerlessDays Amsterdam, Kubernetes Community Days, to name a few. I put on a lot of meetups as well, like the DevOps Amsterdam meetup, Amsterdam Ruby Meetup, and the Dutch Kubernetes meetup. I’ve helped external communities adopt and enforce a Code of Conduct and recruit a diverse line-up. I’ve supported communities to go online as well, and have a such experience with Streamyard, Restream, Twitch, and the likes.

I am technical (I can code), I have communication skills, a passion for product, and a heart for D&I and accessibility.

projects.title: Ruby Open Source Software conf (ROSS)
projects.description:
ROSS conf is a one-day mini-conference bringing Open Source Software maintainers and (first-time) contributors together in one room.  
October 23, 2020: ROSS Conf Remote, w/ rubyfmt, Faraday, Skunk, and Gemstash 
May 11-12, 2018: ROSS Conf Amsterdam, w/ exercism, RVM, Homebrew, Foreman, and the WeTransfer API
September 26, 2015: ROSS Conf Berlin, w/ Bundler, Ruby Object Mapper and... Ruby itself
April 25, 2015 ROSS Conf Vienna, w/ exercism.io (Katrina Owen), RVM (Michal Papis) and diaspora*

projects.title: Rails Girls Rotterdam
projects.description: In November and December we've been busy setting up a Rails Girls event in Rotterdam. Everything from recruiting coaches, writing sponsors (Rails Girls is a non-profit organization targeted on getting more women and girls into technology), arranging merch and guides to be printed, figuring out the location of the event and accommodation for the coaches all the way to promoting it and approaching applicants personally. Rails Girls Rotterdam will take place mid-January 2013.

projects.title: Cash Mob Rotterdam
projects.description: De eerste cash mob in Rotterdam werd op zaterdag 7 april 2013 georganiseerd. Maar wat is dat cash mob-gebeuren nou eigenlijk? Het idee achter een cash mob is om mensen te motiveren om lokale, kleine bedrijven te bezoeken en daar, met z'n allen, centjes uit te geven. Hiermee geef je de onderneming een economisch zetje in de rug. Een win-win situatie voor zowel onderneming als cash mobber, want de deelnemende bedrijven geven deze dag een leuke korting of give-away. En een win voor ons, want wij zien mensen graag blij!

projects.title: Coders without Borders
projects.description: We're a bunch of coders from CEE - as the startup kids call it - Central and Eastern Europe. With coderswithoutborders.eu we intend to bring together Ruby developers from Austria, the Czech Republic and Slovakia, by listing and promoting developer meetups and encouraging YOU to travel and attend a meetup in a different country every now and then. Our unofficial-official plan is to organize crossborder conferences in the near future.

contributors.headline: Staff Community Program Manager at Aiven, Microsoft MVP for Developer Technologies

projects.title: PyLadies Vienna
projects.description: The Viennese chapter of Pyladies, focused on getting more women into the Python community and programming. The 20th of July 2013 we'll set up a beginners course, guiding the attendees through the Python course of Codecademy. Some of the coaches will prepare a little lightning talk. That talk could be about a lot of things. It could be about web fundamentals (HTML/CSS/maybe even Javascript), it could be a bentobox exercise (borrowed from the Rails Girls program), an introduction to Git and GitHub, or the terminal... The course will take a full day, we'll split the attendees up in groups, based on level of experience.

profile_positions.title: Senior Developer Relations Program Manager

profile_positions.description: Turning the engineers’ challenges (from supporting offline consumption of developer documentation, to the eery bug discovered while provisioning a server) into content. Writing abstracts (or even entire talks), and identifying the appropriate conferences.  Attending conferences, meetups, and participating in online communities to gain mindshare from developers and users.  Analysing support requests to improve documentation.
profile_positions.title: Developer Advocate

profile_positions.description:
5starts is sektor5's incubator program for early-stage AdTech, Fintech, ecommerce and SaaS start-up ventures. 5starts draws from sektor5's extensive alumni network when it comes to trainers and program managers.

Nominee Best Incubator / Accelerator Investorinnen.com Awards 2017
Best Incubator / Accelerator in Austria - Central European Startup Awards 2016
Most Influential Woman in Austria by SAP - Central European Startup Awards 2016

I continue to support and guide entrepreneurs both from the 5starts program, and the larger community. I’m frequently asked to join jury’s for instances facilitating public funding rounds. Startups know to reach out once they’re looking for help in the market research, or ‘Product’ department. I’ve helped multiple teams find their CTO or first developer lead.
profile_positions.title: Founder & Program Lead 5starts
